snippet: What’s actually raising health care costs is a predatory industry.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Topher Spiro, vice president for health policy at the Center for American Progress, contends argument advanced by the medical-device industry that a tax on medical devices contained within health care reform law will stifle innovation and increase health care costs is disingenuous; says main reason for rising costs is lack of price competition; holds the industry needs to share responsibility of lowering costs for patients, businesses and taxpayers.
lead_paragraph: What’s actually raising health care costs is a predatory industry.

headline.main: The Myth of the Medical-Device Tax
